tweets.text:
Take your knowledge further with a Flood and Coastal Engineering MSc. 

Scholarships are available, full time for one year starting in September 2021 and will include a 3 month work placement at the @EnvAgency (subject to terms and conditions).

Apply now: https://t.co/qatD7dFz4V https://t.co/FyZCbiKY1s

.@EmmaHowardBoyd champions the importance of resilience within the new @EnvAgency FCERM strategy and a new ¬£200m innovation fund for resilience. Resilience measures have huge returns on investment and have massive benefits for communities the world over. #FloodandCoast2020

tweets.text: @samstebbings18 @DiGeremias @_RobbieMoore @AireIncinerator @EnvAgency @IlkleyChat The council can only operate within the laws of the country. The laws of the country have, for a decade now, been under Tory control. The environment sec could step in. It‚Äôs pretty simple. Robbie is choosing to let this happen and then using it as a political weapon.
We are appealing for information to catch those responsible for dumping asbestos into a Mill Leat in Sowton Village, Devon https://t.co/0LSNdRejx2
This is a #wastecrime. If you have any information about who dumped this hazardous waste circa 20 November contact our 24/7 hotline 0800 807060 or Crimestoppers 0800 555111.

It is incredibly irresponsible to illegally dump asbestos, with no regard given to the public or environment as seen here at the Mill Leat in Sowton. In limited circumstances we can arrange the clearance of waste and this asbestos will be removed shortly. https://t.co/zh3QbnqV1j

.@annietrev tells delegates that at the forthcoming Climate Ambition Summit countries will be invited to make new commitments on #adaptation. Government will be building momentum by launching the #RacetoResilience. #FloodandCoast2020. @EnvAgency

tweets.text: Amazing talk by @Feargal_Sharkey on the disastrous neglect by policymakers and @EnvAgency of the Cam and other rivers. Tells us to take inspiration for a civic fight back from the Northern Ireland Civil Rights Movement.

Last week @NaturalEngland , @ForestryComm and @EnvAgency joined forces to stop damage to the River Lugg. Evidence was collected and is now being assessed . A legal investigation is  underway. Read more here: https://t.co/xMIzo9dITb

And following the session we will be moving straight on to the #FCExcellenceAwards to see outstanding examples of FCERM and #ClimateAction in practice! Premiering on the @EnvAgency Youtube channel at https://t.co/D6mslVY2mh #FloodandCoast2020

tweets.text:
I suspect the @EnvAgency aren't the only ones facing a lot of questions right now.

https://t.co/0henisay7m

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

Good to hear @ZacGoldsmith, responding to questions on CBD #COP15 in Lords, confirming UK support for targets to reverse global biodiversity loss - underpinned by 'clear accountability and implementation mechanisms'. Such underpinning must apply to domestic targets as well

tweets.text: @lisegirl1 @karleburford @Severnsidebirds @bristolbirding We care, but it seems to me that  @EnvAgency and @NaturalEngland are complete derelict these days in their duties to protect the environment and it‚Äôs non-human occupants.

@RobertaBirder @karleburford @Severnsidebirds @bristolbirding I know. It‚Äôs a crime. Short Eared Owls, Kestrels and Buzzards use the trees for hunting the saltmarsh. They are full of Fieldfare and Redwings this week. No one cares.

tweets.text: @RobertaBirder @EnvAgency To raise the flood bank. They decided they wouldn‚Äôt go around the trees ( the bank is currently infront of them) so they are removing them all so the bank goes over them. So sad. Tried everything. The trees are full of birds.
